alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT/930 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Florida and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in Florida, Gadsden and Jackson. In southwest Georgia, Decatur and Seminole. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT /930 PM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 PM EDT /728 PM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches is possible over the area. This additional rain could result in additional minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marianna, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Cypress, Drakes Still, Dellwood, Fairchild, Lake Seminole, Seminole State Park, Two Egg, Lovedale, Star, River Junction, Blue Spring, Hardin Heights, Jinks, Rosedale and Chipola Terrace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
